Reviews.Title: “Good service...”
Reviews.Author: Icgrs
Reviews.Content: We came here on a family vacation. The hotel is about half an hour away from San Juan...& the coast. The hotel is situated carter inland, so you get a sense of the islands verdant beauty. There is a casino semi connected, an outdoor pool with two slides,& hot tub. The exercise room is adequate, as was the size of the room. The crib we requested was waiting for us. The in-hotel restaurant was ok, but we were hoping for more authentic food...we had rented a car, & I think this is key. Luquillo beach isn't too far away, and everything is close enough that you can drive. It was a fine time with the family, a little pricey for what you were getting, but most Sheratons have promotions.

Reviews.Title: “Half way from San Juan to the South”
Reviews.Author: LoveToVacateMichigan
Reviews.Content: Stay here on business occasionally. Average hotel. Rooms are a OK. I have never ate on sight. Think of it as a 3.5 start hotel and it will meet expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Would have hoped for more”
Reviews.Author: Abbeyny
Reviews.Content: I wish I could be more positive while people were nice the food was terrible and the service slow and unacommodating. I asked for fruit for my son and they said they only serve it at breakfast. I ordered a mushroom omlette and it came with no mushrooms. My husband ordered an egg quesadilla which supposedly came with salsa and sour cream it came with neither. The rooms were loud. We heard the entire movie of our neighbor. But that said there are pretty much no other options so its your best bet. Did have a nice pool for the kids to play in. That was a saving grace.

Reviews.Title: “Last minute reservation...”
Reviews.Author: Wislie
Reviews.Content: We made a last minute reservation which we don't regret. Very nice hotel and good service, specially from Juan Morales at front desk... We will come back and we highly recommend. Just one thing, they should have comment cards to thanks those who made ojr stay a pleasent one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a few kinks”
Reviews.Author: DrSopa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Cauguas during the second weekend of November. At first I was very impressed with the room. We booked a standard room, and we got what I would call a jr suite with a living room and small kitchen area separated from the bedroom. This hotel is conveniently located near the highway but it is not at the center of everything so getting to San Juan is about a 20-30 min trip. I thought the hotel was very family friendly (even though it has a casino) and may be a good choice for families trying to get away from San Juan's busiest areas. I think the casino atmosphere was nice for those who enjoy that type of activity. The hotel had a few problems, as other have mentioned parking is a bit painful. The parking lot when we got in was very crowded and was difficult to find a spot. I think they should have some sort of designated area for guests. Other issues we had was the shower pressure seemed to oscillate and our shower head had a leak. The fitness center machines were lacking maintenance. Also their printing systems does not work so it is hard to do certain things if you are traveling on business. Overall we had a calm visit, the hotel staff was very courteous and where quick to address any issues we brought up, but there is a lot of room for improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but a drive to find things to do”
Reviews.Author: dayhiker3458
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel with a casino and a nearby golf course. Its not in town, but just on the outskirts. For thosew ho enjoy the Latin plaza strolls in the evening, its not there. Very much a business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Luxury”
Reviews.Author: eve f
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, its a sheraton, you could never go wrong with a sheraton, This hotel is located in Caguas, about 20 min from San Juan, Has a great Casino and great parking, located in a nice residential area. Noo great restaurant, but if your like me , Im looking for my great cup of coffee in the morning, a little expensive but very good, The pastries and pastelitos are excellent for a quick breakfast, service is good and hotel is very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Below my expectations”
Reviews.Author: marysolc
Reviews.Content: First I pay for a hotel room looking at the golf course and I got a room with a view of a wall, I call i was move right away to the the 3rd floor to a view of a bad kept little river . The hotel really needs restotation and remodeling. The carpet in the entire Hotel look very run down, our bathroom was terrible the toilet had an ongoing noise and the fan noise was annoying. The a/c unit didnt work :(. We just came from a vacation from Four Points by Sherathon at Cocoa Beach that it was so nice to encounter this disaster. It was very below our expectations. I couldnt believe this hotel belongs to the Starwoods hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Not so convenient but a good casino”
Reviews.Author: Wil93
Reviews.Content: I travel to Puerto Rico often. This time, looking for an option other than the San Juan and Isla Verde area, I decided to try the Four Points by Sheraton Caguas Real. Big mistake!! I arrived late at night and I had to park on the street. Security would not allow me to drive my rental car in the premises not even to check in and drop off my luggage, so I had to carry everything for about 1/8 of a mile on the street without sidewalk and no illumination at all. It was scary! Later on I heard that the casino visitors (not hotel guests) flooded the parking lot and often hotel guests have to park outside the facility. I thought, â€œI understand, not a big deal it will only be a parking issue and I will enjoy the restâ€�. Wrong! When I checked in, they only had a handicap accessible room available. I was told to stay in that room, the next night they would honor my reservation with the room that I requested. When I went to the room, it was the most disgusting thing that I had ever seen. There was a chair bolted to the shower floor, old, rusty and disgusting. Skipped the shower that night. At least the bed was clean. Following night went to the front desk to exchange the room. I was thinking, â€œit is only a glitch and the second night will be better. Wrong again! The employee on duty told me that she was unaware of any request to change rooms but I could wait until the following night to get a different room. At that point I decided to check out and take my chances w/o reservations and go back to Isla Verde. The hotel employees were as friendly as they could. The casino looks like fun but staying there was too much hassle. There is a fairly high daily parking fee, a computer in the lobby that constitutes the business center. Hallways and lobby area are really beautiful as well as the main entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Well Kept and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: GJGPrescott
Reviews.Content: Clean, simple, modern hotel with a fairly attentive staff. Nice pool and decent food at the on-site restaurant. No in-room refrigerator or safe. The gym is small but clean and features up to date equipment. There is a casino attached to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Puertorican Hospitality at the Gateway to Inland Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: NanitaNorway_Maine
Reviews.Content: It's a small gem of a hotel, with excellent quality service. Caguas is only about 30 minutes from the San Juan International Airport. The hotel has a casino, and entertainment on the premises. The staff at the hotel was truly exemplary. They were always kind and corteous, helpful with information, calling taxis, suggestions for activities, and always smiling! Caguas is a good alternative to the hectic scene in San Juan. There is a golf course nearby, and views of a small stream. The coquis (tree frogs) will sing you to sleep at night, and you can even see the stars. The restaurant on the premises is just adequate, but there are good eateries nearby, and taxi service is available for a very modest price. The Municipality of Caguas has an artesan's feast every Friday evening, with eateries, entertainment venues, and artesans at the Main Plaza until late into the evening. We had dinner at Raices, an eatery just a short taxi drive away, where we enjoyed mofongo (savory fried green plantains, mashed), and a thirst quenching pina colada in their signature tin cup. Raices is a restaurant chain (there is one in Old San Juan), and the establishment decor will take you back to Borinquen's roots. Nearby you can also explore the Guavate area, with numerous truly typical eateries, and artesans. Check out ARTE GUAVATE (www.arteguavate@hotmail.com) where you can purchase typical wooden mortars for crushing up garlic and spices. I recommend this hotel for a change of scenery, and as a good base to explore other parts of the island.

Reviews.Title: “A Den of Thieves - Avoid At All Costs”
Reviews.Author: ReindeerCowboy
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in March 2010. Like other reviewers, I booked via Priceline for a set price with fees and taxes included. After checking out at the reception desk and being told I owed nothing, I was later charged additional fees and taxes. When I called the manager of the billing department, she pretend not to speak English once I mentioned the unauthorized charges. 6 months later, I had another multi-hundred dollar unauthorized charge on my credit card from this hotel. The corporate offices of Sheraton tell me I have to deal with the deceptive and dishonest people that ripped me off in the first place. I'll never be fairly compensated for the hours of time it will take me to get these unauthorized charges removed. I travel every month, this hotel is the worst I've ever stayed at or heard of.

Reviews.Title: “Four Points Sheraton-Caguas, Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Kimbers08
Reviews.Content: Nice pool, nice staff, clean room, beautiful views. There is a casino adjascent to the hotel (the Casino Real).

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton at its worst. Oversell, under delivered.”
Reviews.Author: Justbeinghonest00
Reviews.Content: Booked a deluxe suite overlooking the golf course & lush mountains, assigned a view to a wall and A/C unit. Moved right away to a room with partial view, but nothing as described or shown on their web site. I am still trying to figure out where the picture from the web site was taken from, not representative from what you find. The room we were moved, the bathroom light was out, a lamp not working, and the smell was hard to describe, but intolerrable. We booked for 5 night, stayed only 1 requested cancellation without penalties. The Manager was apologetic, and quickly reduce the room rate, and cancelled ther rest of the days, but the damage has been done, never again. We packed up and drove to El Conquistador in Fajardo, it was PARADISE, a 5 start Waldoft Property, less money and a waterfront room overlooking the ocean for less money !!! Back to the Sheraton in Caguas, if traveling as a single female, and if arriving at night, I do not recommend the drive to this hotel. The town of Caguas, Humacao & Fajardo are wonderful, and a better and more beautiful stay than San Juan, however, they are in desperate need of more top notch resorts.

Reviews.Title: “a little drive, nice room”
Reviews.Author: taragailblack
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to PR. We decided to stay off the beach and right in the mountains. It's a short distance from the beaches of San Juan, but with traffic this can be a 40 min to 1 hr drive. There is very little in Caguas, but it's in reach of several sights including the rain forest. The casino was nice, but we are not much gamblers. We would definitely stay again...

Reviews.Title: “very good value for your dollar”
Reviews.Author: elpuertorican
Reviews.Content: hotel was very nice .nightly entertanment was great .just the parking should be free of charge for guest of the hotel.i would come back on my next trip to the island

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: stiphy
Reviews.Content: After a hell of a travel day that left me stuck in SJU, AA put me up in this hotel and covered my taxi from and back to the airport. When I arrived I thought, wow, this place looks like way more fun than the Best Western at SJU. I was right. I had dinner at the bar in the restaraunt and met some nice folks there along with a great bartender. After a nice, affordable, simple bite to eat I decided to check out the Casino. It was Saturday night and the place was alive. There was a live band (Latin music), tons of attractive PR women (too bad I'm married but the flirt was fun), and the table minimums were very low ($2 roulette). I quickly made some friends, played some games with comped drinks, and had an absolute blast. Only problem I had is at one point I opened a bar tab and when I went to retrieve my card someone had ran up my bill. The bartender had a hard time understanding my explanation (I don't speak Spanish) but someone quickly stepped in to translate. In the end, and without a fight, they took all the extra drinks off my tab and apologized. For being stuck in PR trying to get back home to St. Croix I had an absolute blast. I don't know what it would be like to head there as a tourist, but I may hop on over to PR one Saturday, rent a car, do some shopping at Best Buy, have some fun in the Casino and them come back on Sunday. It was a great time in March and I imagine it would be a great time now.0.

Reviews.Title: “Undisclosed charges”
Reviews.Author: lenandpatricia
Reviews.Content: This is the first hotel we stayed at on our PR/St John vacation. We learned a valuable lesson - always ask if all charges are covered in the price quoted. AAA quoted a charge of $145 per night. The actual charge was $190.65. In addition to service fee/tariff - $15.95, room tax - $15.95, service fee tax - $1.75, we were also charged a daily parking fee of $12. We had booked for two nights, but only stayed one. If we had not arrived late afternoon after a long trip from our home in NH, we would not have stayed there at all. I hate to be nickle-dimed. Please give me the total cost up front. Also, the hotel is located in the middle of the island. There is nothing there. Their web site leads you into believing that they have a golf course. They are next to a golf course, but the hotel has no connection with it, so if you are thinking about getting a discount on greens fees, forget it. They offer a golf course view when you book. We were on the golf course side, but had no view of the golf course. We did have a good view of the air conditioning equipment. They have a casino which I guess is the main attraction. We are not gamblers, so that was not important to us. The front desk will tell you that there are no local good restaurants except fast food. If you go north on route one for ten minutes, you will find some restaurants in a city the name of which I do not recall. The room itself was new and clean, with a comfortable bed. No complaint there.

Reviews.Title: “Okay.....”
Reviews.Author: BeenthereWorcester
Reviews.Content: Nothing available in San Juan after coming back from our cruise. This hotel is fine, but WAY out. $56.00 cab ride from the cruise pier, which means we didn't opt to go into San Juan again. Hertz rental cars onsite...no cars available for 2 days. One restaurant on site, one spot for breakfast, a wine and sushi bar open in the evening, and a casino for those who must gamble. Positives: Clean, good service, nice pool area Negatives: Too far from anything unless you rent a car.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate business hotel -- weak breakfast”
Reviews.Author: BarryAZ
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel Wednesday and Thursday nights, June 13 & 14, 2007. I was there on business. The room was comfortable, clean, and quiet (even though the hotel is right by a freeway). My only real complaint was about the breakfast. My rate included a free continental breakfast, for which I received vouchers when I checked in. They have a very small cafe called "David's Cookies" next to the lobby. Think Starbucks -- only smaller -- with one or two people working there. The voucher was good for any combination of three items from a very short list: coffee (good), juice (Tropicana, in plastic bottles), and pastries (so-so). Mainly I fault the system here: You stand in line (about 5 minutes one morning, when one of the two employees was missing) in order to be handed your three items. I much prefer the typical (elsewhere) self-serve breakfast area, where there is usually greater variety (yogurt, fruit, etc), you can get what you want quickly, and go back for seconds.

Reviews.Title: “The positives outweigh the negatives”
Reviews.Author: DGlass
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Four Points in Caguas between December 25 and December 30, 2006. The hotel was a mixed bag. If youâ€™re looking for the typical Puerto Rican big hotel near the beach, look elsewhere. This hotel is nowhere near the beach, but if this is not a problem, it is a nice hotel. We were visiting family in Juncos (the next town over), so it was a convenient location for us. The Positives: Nice, clean, modern rooms and public areas. The service was professional. The rooms were nice and the king-sized bed was comfortable. The air conditioning and television worked fine. The outdoor pool area was clean and modern. The hotel also had a very good workout room and offered two computers with Internet access for guests. The Negatives: Since the hotel is constructing a casino, we were awakened to the sounds of hammering every morning at 7:15 a.m. We did request relocation to a quieter room, which was accommodated, but we could still hear the sounds of hammering. Since we woke up so early, the hotel should offer, at least, complimentary breakfast, but it did not. The cost of parking was too high $10.75 (including tax), especially since the hotel is located in what is really a pretty rural area. I wonder if they intend to discontinue the parking fee once the casino is opened, to compete with the dozens of other casinos all over Puerto Rico. Finally, the water pressure was inconsistent. All in all, however, the positives outweighed the negatives and we will probably stay at the Sheraton Four Points again when visiting family in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Problems with the park”
Reviews.Author: Italusa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel from AUGUST 5 to 10. I booked this hotel with travelocity. Its only one Problem you have to prepare 10 dolars for everiday if you stay there for the parking nobody told me that... so i had to paid 50$ more only for the park!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel July 2006. I booked this hotel with travelocity. The staff was great. The room was fantastic. This was a great experience. Very close to the highway, easy access, 15 minutes from San Juan. We chose this hotel because I knew that , this type of hotel in The center of San Juan, would cost a lot more. Super fast DSL internet access. LOve it. Thanks to the Four Point Sheraton Staff in Caguas. FRANK & LIZ from PA

Reviews.Title: “the worst”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I could embellish the unpleasantness and the misfortune having booked this hotel on-line, but one left turn into the parking lot will confirm your worst fears...the hotel is nowhere near completion...the jackhammers start promptly at 6:30 AM. We were allowed into the parking lot, though not out...you must pay "up front" $10 per night for the duration of your stay,. whether you occupy the parking space or not. After an arduous flight from San Francisco, we were subjected to a 25 minute wait, while the one clerk on duty answered phone calls. When asked for assistance with our luggage, we were pointed to a luggage rack. We originally booked this hotel for one week (through EXPEDIA)...we arrived on a Tuesday...and mercifully left on Thursday...we were treated by the staff with unmitigated disdain, at best. Though we chose to leave this hotel with five unused days for which we were charged, it was a merciful blessing to leave. I have stayed at many hotels throughout the world, some good, some not so good...this the worst...if you seek dust, noise and incredible attitude from staff that are purported to make your stay pleasant, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Four Points by Sheraton at Caguas, Puerto Rico. The service and facility were awesome. The hotel is cozy and quiete. Its a perfect ambiance for those wanting to get away. The hotel is constructing a casino, and despite the construction, the hotel is kept very clean. I highly recommend this hotel, if you are looking to get away and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in caguas.”
Reviews.Author: bobretired
Reviews.Content: We liked staying at this hotel as we were visiting friends in the Caguas area. Once inside you could be at any courtyard hilton garden inn or 4 points in the country. The room was clean and nice. Thje hotel is on the outskirts of town and this is a benefit for easily getting around. The hotel is convenient to all of caguas. We did not eat at the hotel at all drove out to a panaderia (5 min for breakfast). You are 10 minutes from the lechonerias. Don't miss these.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, a little far out”
Reviews.Author: Gracebayclt
Reviews.Content: I am an airline employee and frequently travel on short notice for long weekends. San Juan can be expensive and I utilize Expedia and hotels. I did not find any reasonable options so went to Sheraton's own website and found Four Points. It was about a 35-40 mile drive from the airport (Avis rental) to the hotel. The desk representatives were very nice when I had to call for better directions. Route 52 exit 22 is the best way, Route 1 will take you a little out of the way. This hotel is brand new. The front desk area and David's Cookies are spotless. I had an omelet with croissant and juice at David's for breakfast at about $5.75, they will charge to your room. The room was spotless. The double beds slept very comfortably, the extra pillows on the bed is a nice touch. The pool area is nice with towels on the lounge chairs. The employees are nice and helpful, most of them are bi-lingual, but when they are not, they did not mind finding someone to help in English if you need that. The restaurant came to $31 with 2 entree's, 2 drinks, no appetizers for 2. I didn't like what I had, my neice was fine, and the server was nice. She asked " I heard you speaking English, would you like another menu?" and "Why didn't you tell me you didn't like it?" upon my not eating the spicy dish, Mofongo?. They will also charge to your room for your convenience though they are independent of the hotel. Checking in and out was fast and went smoothly, no line either time. I did check in at 8pm though Saturday and out 10am Monday. Not exactly rush hour. The bathroom fan did not work and right before checking out, we realized a water leak coming from upstairs, through the fan, dripping onto the floor. They did a nice job making the beds, and straightening the room when you are out. This was the best quality for the money if you don't mind a 40 minute drive into San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Home sweet home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a night at the Four Points by Sheraton Caguas Real Hotel with my fiance. It is really a boost to the economy in the valley of Caguas. I am a native of Caguas and will be returnung home after my retirement from military service and will like to commend the Sheraton Corp for spearheading the developing of family environment hotels in the area. The facilities are very nice and the rooms are great. I did have a very special dinner with my fiance at The Paseo which is the restaurant located at the hotel. There was a trio there which performed a very special song for my significant other. They performed beutifully and were very corteous to my request. I cant wait to come back and take her there again for more days. Hopefully I can get the same room upgrade!

HotelInfo.Name: Four Points by Sheraton Caguas Real Hotel & Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 500 Alhambra en Granada Blvd. | Caguas, Caguas 00726, Puerto Rico
